isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: MIDLAND MODELS EL-1300 AND EL-1600 - DISASSEMBLE - CRANKSHAFT AND BEARINGS

svcproc.title: CRANKSHAFT AND BEARINGS

note.para: On compressors that have sleeve (bushing) type bearings, if visual inspection shows that the crankshaft and/or bearing (bushing) is damaged, replace the compressor.

important.para: Do not remove crankshaft and bearings from crankcase unless an inspection reveals the necessity for removal.

svcproc.para: The following procedure is for compressors with ball bearing type crankshaft bearings.

step1.para: Remove the four crankshaft bearing cap bolts on each bearing cap and remove caps. Discard gaskets.
Press the shaft seal from front bearing cap and discard seal.
Remove seal and bowed washer or spring from rear bearing cap.

Place crankcase-crankshaft-bearing assembly in an arbor press, supporting crankcase adjacent to rear bearing. Use an adapter as shown in Figure 12and press crankshaft rear bearing and crank assembly from crankcase.
With rear bearing free from case, use a bearing puller and pull rear bearing from crankshaft.
Remove crankshaft with front bearing out through bottom of case.
Use bearing puller and remove front bearing.
